mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Martha Washington to Francis Bassett Washington, 1793 February 8
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha Washington writes from Philadelphia to 'My Dear Fanny.' Southern post not in yet -- all are well -- winter has been warm, causes a sickly season -- Mr. Blair says many friends "are dead below" -- warm winter -- farmers ploughed all winter -- afraid there will be no ice for ice houses in the city -- hears from Mrs. Stuart -- she [Mrs. Stuart] hasn't seen Mr. Fairfax and doesn't know whether he got to England -- Mrs. Harrison is well -- Mrs. Mercer in town and sick -- love to the Major -- "I hope ere this that he has got the better of the spitting Blood you mentioned in your last." Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, laminated, docketed by F. Washington "Feb. 8th," George Washington's watermarked paper (incomplete). Name on original manuscript appears as "M. Washington".
